byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

abstract: United States sends 11 warships to waters off Yemen as show of force and warning to Iran to cease sending weapons to Houthi rebels; ships are also meant to reassure American ally Saudi Arabia and could be used to intercept Iranian arms supplies.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration cast the deployment on Monday as primarily a show of force to discourage Iran’s shipments of weapons to rebels.

headline.main: Warning Iran, U.S. Sends Two More Ships to Yemen
headline.print_headline: Warning Iran, U.S. Sends Two More Ships to Yemen

snippet: The Obama administration cast the deployment on Monday as primarily a show of force to discourage Iran’s shipments of weapons to rebels.
